column4: oh, and i like the default gnome; i dont think i'll use fluxbox as planned. i like how all the tools are just... well, there.
I like using xfce4.  Haven't used gnome much.
I was a KDE user, but now I'm using xfce4.  Haven't used Gnome much.
I used xfce when I had slackware on my laptop
I began using xfce4 some weeks ago when I installed Ubuntu.  Only had 64MB of RAM at the time, so it was suggested I try using it.
Yeah, it's awesome for lightweight stuff.
Now that I have 256MB of RAM, I don't know that I want to go to Gnome.  I used Audacity alot, and doesn't Gnome eat alot of RAM?  I'd rather save it for Audacity.

I'm honestly not sure; the only time I've really used it is with the ubuntu livecd 5 minutes ago. I know that I have ~128mb ram, and it's running pretty smoothly for me (and that's booting from cd, too)
Hmmm...maybe I'll try it sometime.
couldn't hurt; if it's too bulky, just uninstall :p
I'll probably try Gnome once I have a larger HD.  I have a 2GB HD that keeps pretty full, and I don't have Gnome installed right now.  (Just ubuntu-base but not ubuntu-desktop)
ah, right.
See what I mean?
yeah.

Right at this moment I have about 425MB free, and most of that will soon be filled with the audio files I'll be editing.  Then I'll remove them again, and begin my next editing project.  Don't really want to fill that space with Gnome.
(and anyone else who wants to add) If there are any, what are the advantages to using Gnome rather than xfce4?
I'm definitely no Gnome expert, but from my experience it a.) looks really nice and b.) has a lot of useful tools easily accessed (not that xfce doesn't), especially, for me, wireless tools.
Everything is accessible in xcfe4, right?
I believe so, but I'm not sure if there are Gnome-interface-specific tools. I doubt it, but it's possible
Oh, that's right.  Some gnome stuff works in xfce4, but probably not all of them, I would guess.
Fortunately, there aren't any Gnome apps I absolutely need at this time.
I'll chat with you some other time; going to work on something else now...later!
I need the wireless stuff, which I'm not sure if it's gnome-portable
later :)
